subject: Nutrition
title: The Nordic Diet
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Nordic Diet.

hook.text: Scandinavia's traditional diet of fish, berries, and root vegetables rivals the Mediterranean for health.

buildup.text: The New Nordic Diet was formalized in 2004 using local ingredientsâ€”rye, oats, salmon, and wild berries.

discovery.text: Clinical trials show it reduces inflammation and lowers cholesterol as effectively as Mediterranean eating.

twist.text: It uses canola oil instead of olive oilâ€”and the health results are nearly identical to Mediterranean outcomes.

climax.text: The lesson isn't that one region's food is best. Whole foods from any tradition beat processed diets.

punchline.text: Healthy diets look different but share the same principles.
